title: Invalidate session after password reset on https://polldaddy.com

profile.name: Automattic
profile.about: WordPress.com, VaultPress, Akismet, Gravatar, WooCommerce, Polldaddy, Tumblr and more!

vulnerability_information:
Hi there,
I found broken session bug on your website.Your website is unable to validate the session.That may lead takeover victims account.

Reproduce:
1.Go to https://polldaddy.com and log into your account from two different browsers.
2.Now change password from any browser you already logged in
3.You will be still logged into another browser.

Kindly fix this issue.
Thx,

activities.message:
Sorry for the delay getting back to you. I'm closing this ticket. Polldaddy uses oAuth through WordPress.com to login. When you change password you're changing the password on WordPress.com, not on Polldaddy.com. Perhaps the account page should be clearer about this and the implications but I'm not aware of any other similar site describing that situation.

You can disconnect Polldaddy from WordPress.com on https://wordpress.com/me/security/connected-applications but if someone is already logged into Polldaddy they'll remain logged in until Polldaddy tries to authenticate again. The same issue happens if you login to a website by using Facebook.

activities.message:
No, there is no vulnerability as this is how oAuth works.

As an example, login to Spotify with your Facebook account. Now change your Facebook password and you'll still be logged into Spotify. Even if you disconnect Spotify in Facebook's "application settings" page you'll still be logged into Spotify until you close that browser window or Spotify tries to authenticate you again.
